comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The photo above is from a catalog page labeled "Schneider & Cie." [Schneider et Compagnie] -- Schneider was/is a Swiss company, located in the French-speaking part of Switzerland. The 20-cm. gun appears to be positioned to defend locks on a canal.

Three Bain/LOC photos of the "Schneider Coast Defence Train" were posted to Flickr three months ago:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4909923979/]

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Schneider & Cie. (aka Schneider-Creusot) has nothing to do with Switzerland, it's a French corporation, now Schneider Electric en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schneider-Creusot fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schneider_Electric

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for your research.  According to the library's authority file, B-59, Schneider took over Creusot and the company came to be known as Schneider & Cie in 1838.  Thanks for identifying the other Schneider images Wystan.  We'll add the company name to the records the next time we update.
